title: AWS Sales Engineer
location: New York, New Jersey, or Texas
description: Join Adastra as an AWS Sales Engineer to shape the future of cloud computing across North America and Europe. This role involves pre-sales activities, delivery of proof of concepts, and supporting AWS partnership goals. You'll build client relationships, create presentations, and lead workshops while spotting new AWS opportunities.
requirements: Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience in technical presales or as a customer-facing solution architect
Solid understanding of AWS services like S3, Redshift, SageMaker, Lambda, and ETL pipelines
Experience with cloud-based Data & Analytics solutions
Knowledge of Data Science and Advanced Analytics in the cloud
A degree in a technical field (or equivalent experience)
A self-starter attitude and a hunger to learn the latest in cloud tech
Experience leading large-scale cloud projects (Bonus)
AWS certifications (Bonus)

companyInfo.description: Adastra is an international consulting company focused on data and analytic solutions in Cloud, Data Management, Analytics, AI and ML, Governance, Hyper Automation, and Enterprise Application Development.

benefits: Opportunity for advancement and career progression
Satisfaction of working for a reputable company
A flexible, dynamic, and diverse workplace
matchReason: The candidate's profile aligns with several key aspects of the AWS Sales Engineer role at Adastra, but there are notable gaps primarily related to location and specific AWS experience. The candidate has experience in sales/presales engineering roles, which matches the job's focus on pre-sales activities and client relationship building. Their flexibility in location is beneficial, but the job is specifically based in New York, New Jersey, or Texas, which may not align with the candidate's preference for roles in Australia or remote positions. The candidate's technical background and experience with cloud-based Data & Analytics solutions align well with the job's requirements, including knowledge of AWS services and Data Science. However, the job specifically emphasizes AWS services like S3, Redshift, SageMaker, Lambda, and ETL pipelines, and it is unclear if the candidate has direct experience with all these technologies. Additionally, AWS certifications and experience leading large-scale cloud projects are listed as bonuses, and it is not specified if the candidate possesses these qualifications. Overall, while there is a strong alignment in terms of role responsibilities and technical skills, the geographical and specific AWS experience requirements reduce the match score.

title: Cloud Solution Architect - Instaclustr - Presales
description: An Instaclustr Solutions Engineer at NetApp leads the technical strategy for greenfield and installed base accounts. Working in tight collaboration with Sales colleagues, SEs align technical and service capabilities to customer needs and articulate how companies will benefit from partnering with NetApp. This position will support both our National & Global Sales Teams with a primary focus on our Western US Regional Sales Teams & Customers.
requirements: Find and support opportunities in new and existing customers in close collaboration with Sales
Translate customer business needs into technical solutions based on Instaclustr offerings
Partner with SMEs, Sales, Customer Success and other groups to create comprehensive solutions
Develop and own key stakeholder relationships within the customer and partner communities
Conduct demonstrations and lead POCs in collaboration with SMEs as needed
Demonstrate a good understanding of both business and technology strategy
Use NetApp’s sales tools to effectively manage accounts, opportunities & pipeline
Understand Open Source technologies, with emphasis on one or more of the Instaclustr projects
Use of or strong knowledge of technologies like Cassandra, Kafka, PostgreSQL, Spark, OpenSearch, Valkey, ClickHouse, Cadence
Drive results through customer obsession and being the technical authority to win opportunities
A minimum 8 to 12 years of experience is desired
A bachelor's degree in computer science or a similar field is a plus but not required

companyInfo.description: NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer.

matchReason: The candidate's profile indicates flexibility in location, which is a positive aspect for remote or hybrid roles. However, the job is located in Bakersfield, CA, and does not mention remote or hybrid work options, which may not align with the candidate's preference for location-flexible roles. The role is a Cloud Solution Architect with a focus on presales, which aligns with the candidate's experience in sales/presales engineering. The job requires a strong understanding of specific technologies such as Cassandra, Kafka, PostgreSQL, and others, as well as experience with Open Source technologies, which may or may not align with the candidate's technical expertise depending on their background. The requirement of 8 to 12 years of experience is a potential match if the candidate meets this criterion. However, the lack of flexibility in working arrangements and the specific location requirement significantly lowers the match score for a candidate seeking flexible work arrangements.

title: Manager 2, Pre-Sales Engineering
description: Come join the Mid-Market Sales team as a front line leader within the Presales Sales Engineering team. We are not your typical sales organization. Nothing is more important to us than the success of our customers, which is why we are investing in the growth of this vital piece of our ecosystem. We are problem solvers, strategic thinkers, solution seekers, team players, and consultative experts who use the latest tools and technology to solve our customers’ most important problems. The solutions we present are backed by collaborative cross-functional teams. This is a newly created leadership role to help manage our rapidly growing SE organization.
requirements: 5+ years of leadership experience in a SaaS B2B sales organization (Presales, Sales Engineering, Solutions Consulting, Solutions Engineering)
Proven ability to coach and mentor those around you.
Accounting industry experience, sales process and Mid-Market expertise is a plus.
High degree of professionalism, emotional intelligence and empathy.
Excellent communicator, experience in learning styles, self-managed.
Strong analytical, planning, and problem-solving skills with a deep understanding of sales levers, metrics, performance standards and sales methodology.
Unwavering positive attitude, strong drive for results, and able to work through ambiguity.
High level of accountability and follow through, keeping an ‘owner’s mindset’
Bachelor’s degree or MBA preferred.
matchReason: The candidate has experience in sales/presales engineering roles, which aligns with the core focus of the job. However, the job is located in Plano, TX, and the candidate is seeking location-flexible roles, preferably hybrid in Sydney or remote within Australia. This geographical mismatch significantly impacts the match score. The candidate's flexibility in location is a critical factor, and the job does not offer remote or hybrid options that align with the candidate's preferences. Additionally, while the candidate has relevant experience in sales engineering, the job requires 5+ years of leadership experience in a SaaS B2B sales organization, which may or may not align with the candidate's background depending on their leadership experience. The candidate's profile does not specify experience in the accounting industry, which is a plus for the job. Overall, while there is a skills match, the location and specific industry experience requirements reduce the overall match score.

title: Presales Engineer (Enterprise Content Management)
description: As a Solution Consultant/Presales Engineer at OpenText, you will be a core member of the sales team, identifying and developing revenue opportunities. You will analyze customer business issues and provide a compelling value proposition by leveraging OpenText EIM solutions. The role involves leading presales technical/functional support activities, identifying customer business drivers, and providing technical leadership to deliver successful solutions.
requirements: 5+ years of customer-facing pre-sales experience focused on the information lifecycle
Experience both using and selling AI tools and applications
Analytical and creative mindset
Experience developing solutions and strategies to solve complex business problems
Knowledge of and experience with Enterprise Content Management solutions
Knowledge of and experience with SAP and key SAP business process areas
Experience with GSIs (EY, Deloitte, Accenture) helpful but not required
Experience leading customer-facing engagements such as presentations, demos & POC's
Engaging with customers in PST time zone and extensive travel to clients on west coast

companyInfo.description: OpenText is a global leader in information management, focusing on innovation, creativity, and collaboration.

benefits: Comprehensive and competitive group benefit and healthcare plan
matchReason: The candidate's profile indicates a focus on sales/presales engineering roles with a flexible location preference, ideally in hybrid or remote settings within Australia. The OpenText Presales Engineer role is based in the United States, requiring engagement in the PST time zone and extensive travel to the west coast, which does not align with the candidate's location flexibility preference. Additionally, the role's requirement for experience with Enterprise Content Management solutions, SAP, and GSIs may not align with the candidate's expertise if their experience is primarily in other IT or technology sectors. While the candidate may have relevant sales/presales experience, the geographical and specific technical requirements significantly reduce the match score.

title: Sales Solutions Engineer – Infrastructure & DaaS
description: We are looking for a highly motivated Sales Solutions Engineer with a strong background in IT infrastructure and integration to support our business development efforts across mid-sized enterprise clients. This role is ideal for someone who combines technical experience in datacenter environments with pricing expertise and vendor alignment, particularly in the context of integrated solutions.
requirements: Proven experience in IT infrastructure (datacenter, networking, virtualization, storage)
Previous background in systems integration companies (preferably similar to SONDA or mid-sized IT integrators)
Strong understanding of solution pricing, margin management, and commercial modeling
Technical hands-on experience earlier in career (e.g., field technician or infrastructure engineer) is a strong plus
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
Experience working with DaaS, managed services, or vendor-partner ecosystems is preferred
Located in or willing to work from the Miami area

companyInfo.description: SONDA is the largest IT service provider in Latin America, leader in systems integration, support and IT outsourcing. With almost 50 years of experience and in constant growth around the World, and growing so far in in US, as well.
